item1757582059509.name: Tournament
item1757582059509.description: Whenever a player's town hosts an arena tournament, it will be marked. Marked towns will continuously host new tournaments on a daily basis. Additionally, with the help of a mysterious character, you can help your companions win the arena rankings.

item1757581634141.name: Fighter Ranking & Impact Realm
item1757581634141.description: To prevent you from encountering super-saiyan-like demigods in other mods, I have created a promotion mechanism that allows you and your companions to become the strongest of the strong.

item1757581409988.name: Missing Persons
item1757581409988.description: I've created a simple system for finding people. You can use filters to find the person you want to meet. You can view their profile, appear next to them, or even arrange a marriage.

item1757581273480.name: Resource Management
item1757581273480.description: You can now more conveniently store food and sell low-priced equipment.

item1757581225403.name: Teleport to Settlement
item1757581225403.description: You can now access different settlement teleportation functions based on your status.

item1757579578763.name: Purchase Settlement
item1757579578763.description: When a kingdom's town loyalty drops below 25, you can acquire it through the black market.

item1757579512603.name: Quick Sell Low-Priced Equipment
item1757579512603.description: You can quickly sell equipment that is priced below a set value. (Note: Some equipment cannot be sold.)

item1757579415733.name: Trade Captives
item1757579415733.description: You can buy captive lords of a settlement in the black market.

item1757579320163.name: Black Market Equipment
item1757579320163.description: You can purchase equipment belonging to the troops currently in your party from the black market.

item1757579012200.name: Purchase Garrison
item1757579012200.description: You can purchase elite troops from a settlement's garrison.

item1757578921722.name: Family Granary
item1757578921722.description: You can store surplus food in the family granary. When your settlements are low on food, they will automatically draw from the family granary.

item1757578835088.name: Recruit Troops
item1757578835088.description: You can recruit elite troops from clan parties in the same settlement.

item1757578761732.name: Introduce New Clans
item1757578761732.description: You can introduce five powerful new clans to a specified kingdom to fight and contribute to its cause.

item1757577475941.name: Feast and Drink
item1757577475941.description: As long as you are not a mercenary and have become a lord of a certain kingdom, if your influence is greater than the combined influence of all other clans in that kingdom, you can spend all your influence to become king.

item1.name: New Party Recruits
item1.description: Whenever a new clan party is formed, the system will automatically allocate 30 Tier 1 troops of the clan's culture to the party, helping it form more quickly.

item2.name: Remove Companion's Negative Traits
item2.description: Whenever a companion joins the player's party, if they have negative traits, those traits will be removed and they will be granted a random positive trait.

item3.name: Rename Companion
item3.description: You can now rename your companions.

item4.name: Command Operations
item4.description: You can now command your clan parties, allied kingdom parties, and armies to attack enemy parties or settlements, or to attract nearby parties to your location for protection.

item5.name: Find Enemy Armies
item5.description: You can now quickly find the location of enemy armies, allowing for more flexible decision-making.

item6.name: Persuade Captives
item6.description: You can now persuade captives to convert them into troops for your party and even change their culture. You can also invite captive lords to join your clan to fight alongside you. However, persuaded lords cannot be kingdom leaders, and their original clan must be able to maintain a minimum number of members for the persuasion to be successful.

item7.name: Pregnancy Settings
item7.description: You can use the menu to modify pregnancy settings, including the conditions for allowing pregnancy. The default is to allow pregnancy until you have two children, but you can adjust this limit. You can also enable or disable the setting for always having twins, which is enabled by default.

item8.name: Unconditional War
item8.description: Tired of peace? You can decide which kingdom your nation should go to war with, so you'll no longer be idle.

item9.name: Generate Bandits
item9.description: Not enough bandits for a quest? You can now generate bandits and customize them freely. You might even create a big problem for yourself or the local area.

item10.name: Teleport to Nearest Friendly Town
item10.description: To make it easier to deal with a large number of captives, you can now quickly find a town to sell them.

item1757501634220.name: Black Market Recruitment
item1757501634220.description: You can recruit the same types of troops you currently have in your party from the black market, quickly boosting your party's combat power.

item1757568294831.name: Hideout Bandit Recruitment
item1757568294831.description: You can now recruit bandits corresponding to the culture of a hideout.

item1757571133798.name: Player Stash
item1757571133798.description: You now have a private stash that can be accessed in the black market.

item1757577756727.name: Intrigue and Spies
item1757577756727.description: You can spend influence to have spies instigate wars between kingdoms.

item1757577832439.name: Interfere in State Affairs
item1757577832439.description: You can now spend Denars to forcibly push for policies in various kingdoms.

item1757578379965.name: Peace and War
item1757578379965.description: You can spend influence to decide the fate of a kingdom's war. It is entirely up to you whether they should cease all hostilities or go to war again.

item1757578460210.name: Merge Kingdoms
item1757578460210.description: You can merge any kingdoms to create your own era of warring states.

item1757578545710.name: Territory Redistribution
item1757578545710.description: You can demand a specified kingdom to redistribute its territories, making their distribution fairer.

item1757579926746.name: Instant Siege
item1757579926746.description: After enabling this setting, when you are besieging a settlement, you can immediately begin the assault after destroying the two side walls.

item1757580080934.name: Shields and Blocking
item1757580080934.description: When this setting is enabled, if two people attack each other, the one with the higher running skill can cause a partial attack penetration. When the running skill difference between the two is greater than 120, the penetration damage will increase. Additionally, every attack has a 10% chance to be a critical hit.

item1757580557693.name: Royal Prerogative
item1757580557693.description: As king, you have many privileges. You can now more proactively invite other clans to join your kingdom, reclaim territories, increase the tier of clans within the kingdom, distribute Denars or influence to other clans, or even try to split your own kingdom.

item1757581004943.name: Fine-Tuning
item1757581004943.description:
Here are some fine-tuned adjustments to the game:
Marriage will now always make the spouse join the player's clan.
There is no limit to the number of companions you can have.
Increased the speed of converting captives into regular troops.
Player clan party size will now increase with the number of clan members.
The number of player workshops will now increase with the number of towns owned.
Companions will now be more useful in parties. The total party size, movement speed, and healing speed will vary based on the companions in the party.

item1757581138553.name: Debugging Features
item1757581138553.description: I encountered some bugs while playing other mods, and I have left some of the bug-fixing methods in this mod. You might have a chance to use them, but I hope you never have to.

item1757581759193.name: Fight as Companion
item1757581759193.description: You can now switch your identity during combat and fight as a companion to gain experience and skills for them. The shortcut is Left Ctrl + U.

item1759170760526.name: Labor Market
item1759170760526.description: You can assign prisoners or soldiers to the Labor Market to increase your village's prosperity. The shortcut to open the menu is Left Ctrl + O.

item1759171231862.name: Hotkey and menu
item1759171231862.description:
Quick Command:
After capturing and locking onto a target, press F4.

Function Menu:
The shortcut to open the menu is Left Ctrl + O.

Combat Menu:
Used during combat.
Shortcuts are Left Ctrl + U, Left Ctrl + Shift + U.
